DataElement.preferredDefinition: The stop time of the imaging procedure.   Precision can be truncated by omitting the seconds or both the seconds and minutes (23:59 or 23).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._Put an end to a state or an activity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Tests that produce pictures of areas inside the body.

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.

Property.preferredDefinition: Put an end to a state or an activity.

Concepts.definition: Put an end to a state or an activity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/11/17 jk transferred context and added CSI, registration status per Round 5 finalization task.  9/24/13 curated for imaging trials. tt

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ISO 8061 time recorded as hh:mm:ss based on a 24 hour clock.   Precision can be truncated by omitting the seconds or both the seconds and minutes (23:59 or 23).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 6/30/17 jk transferred context; added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 8/29/13 curated for the CFR Standardization work. tt
